976C19D5654348FA9CF45B06F02FE7D8.description:
Analyze center and variability by:
*Giving quantitative measures of center, describing variability, and any overall pattern, and noting any striking deviations.
*Justifying the appropriate choice of measures of center using the shape of the data distribution.

FF210BE146D948BDBDC738C9B805400E.description:
Describe the collection data by:
*Reporting the number of observations in dot plots and histograms. 
*Communicating the nature of the attribute under investigation, how it was measured, and the units of measurement.

734BEF53FF9E41B5A7E5EBBFD3A11686.description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.

7341E19D9CA9474C80F546758742C52A.description: Compare the attributes of different representations of the same data.

B39845CC176143BFBBC16EBAEF35D8EE.description: Use dot plots, histograms, and box plots to represent data.

B7D105FBEE0749549C0E978C2DA2C8C4.description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line.

AA9A0607947E46649EA57BAF720D62C2.description: Understand that describing the variability of a data set is needed to distinguish between data sets in the same scale, by comparing graphical representations of different data sets in the same scale that have similar measures of center, but different spreads.

693A99136B7547FEB7AED8AF345EC7BE.description:
Determine the measure of center of a data set and understand that it is a single number that summarizes all the values of that data set. 
*Understand that a mean is a measure of center that represents a balance point or fair share of a data set and can be influenced by the presence of extreme values within the data set.
*Understand the median as a measure of center that is the numerical middle of an ordered data set.

2CC43E4DA5884178AF25221F71B0C306.description: Understand that both a measure of center and a description of variability should be considered when describing a numerical data set.

7CB34922732F48759A4F936FE2EBBE30.description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.

3F2158A6BD2C4239BF0511395383525C.description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.

4B51DD3978FF4E5F86CB03E4D3A7DAE9.description: Represent right prisms and right pyramids using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

4506EA8365DE401E927871DC083CCA58.description: Using coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

409745CBAE594A738DC10F23BAFED3D0.description: Drawing polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices.

0331AFE1C86141E784B6CEC5EEA9034A.description: Use the coordinate plane to solve real-world and mathematical problems by:

3DB9E935525F436B9CE2B196DDA3A7CF.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of the volume of a right rectangular prism to find the volume of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths. Apply this understanding to the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

D064BFAB6EF54E5090BD311E213293DD.description: Find the area of special quadrilaterals and polygons by decomposing into triangles or rectangles.

0C1BEA065B1243849B39C26AF904DF3B.description: Find the area of triangles by composing into rectangles and decomposing into right triangles.

7DA557421DF041029C93D55FD23B0459.description: Create geometric models to solve real-world and mathematical problems to:

1B1CFBF37F3B40E088B9CF382F384251.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.

4ECB63E6254B491CA78F4C6BAE4D9C72.description: Analyze the relationship between quantities in different representations (context, equations, tables, and graphs).

30E3AF6EECCC4E1D9E5152278F6D85CA.description: Using variables to represent two quantities in a real-world or mathematical context that change in relationship to one another.

E812A4CA6DD840FFABFC3082BC4E1B7E.description: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships by:

C43FB1903B364642B3908DAEE7DF7302.description: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.

CB22CDC1B4E34FA4B82F85A204C1F541.description: Representing solutions of inequalities on number line diagrams.

BB725CE8C74540FC9DE91C85C4C64FCE.description: Recognizing that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions.

56F06CAA1FEA48F387BA1D80BF84F394.description: Writing an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem.

6D2EF2C3C6BE42E6A342E07DDDCAD24B.description: Using substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an inequality true.

8A8F511EA4B64B378C3299A127842A75.description: * p . x = q in which p, q and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

5A3B943EF015497BB52C97E3EF392225.description: * x + p = q in which p, q and x are all nonnegative rational numbers; and,

0D09C3BBA32A42338D92DCAF0BAEB52F.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form:

B0B2EEEF782C48369C02D913A99C28B0.description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem.

0DC3408DBC1F4BC8BCC638DA188CDA80.description: Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation true

8DCB69FE90ED4862A71EE6022BCCA4A6.description: Reason about and solve one-variable equations.

1CD9040F027546AF90D1EE1396F253CB.description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent and justify with mathematical reasoning.

D1D54334B6F94A538D58CAF620983EF1.description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions without exponents.

3E15CF3EA7DF44B58268E2E29C4243E6.description: Evaluate expressions at specific values of their variables using expressions that arise from formulas used in real-world problems.

7A9E7C3E49834326A863983B4661B85C.description: Identify parts of an expression using mathematical terms and view one or more of those parts as a single entity

2D85DF65F5B84EC7A06C65C581E08376.description: Write expressions that record operations with numbers and with letters standing for numbers

2C768502BE674497BBD1F48C6A025CAE.description: Write, read, and evaluate algebraic expressions.

8736B0E22C8F41429AB54B536BAED647.description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions, with and without grouping symbols, involving whole-number exponents

464D1B4A43C3491C9686FB638CFEC824.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.

D36E8BECA371472B9C82BD2966E38DDB.description: Use models to add and subtract integers from -20 to 20 and describe real-world contexts using sums and differences.

0CEE3C650CD3470AADE9F1C36BF99566.description: Understand subtraction of integers as adding the additive inverse, p − q = p + (– q). Show that the distance between two integers on the number line is the absolute value of their difference.

D30CC3CFDC6E417E855F0ADE6DFDE059.description: Understand p + q as the number located a distance q from p, in the positive or negative direction depending on the sign of q. Show that a number and its additive inverse create a zero pair.

C1AD35E75E204527ADC4940576A36865.description: Describe situations in which opposite quantities combine to make 0.

D19B711473DD423387AC1AF819366068.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction.

9061ECF99B5C419C9C1666D243AAE33F.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

C94381F797DE40BDB1C1B3286291E7B2.description: Write, interpret, and explain statements of order for rational numbers in real-world contexts

D876065C57754DEE972BA8D20809C304.description: Interpret statements of inequality as statements about the relative position of two numbers on a number line diagram.

CAD463928FB44E1ABFE2D4000D3B951C.description:
On a coordinate plane:
*Understand signs of numbers in ordered pairs as indicating locations in quadrants.
*Recognize that when two ordered pairs differ only by signs, the locations of the points are related by reflections across one or both axes.
*Find and position pairs of rational numbers on a coordinate plane.

3D80F5CC73C843158DB9C1F6215C4EE6.description:
On a number line:
*Recognize opposite signs of numbers as indicating locations on opposite sides of 0 and that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself. 
*Find and position rational numbers on a horizontal or vertical number line.

1E3BE5038AA84BD385CF24F51E8B6BF1.description: Understand rational numbers as points on the number line and as ordered pairs on a coordinate plane.

B274D10C03604E4EAAE0721EF74CC60F.description:
Understand the absolute value of a rational number as its distance from 0 on the number line to:
*Interpret absolute value as magnitude for a positive or negative quantity in a real-world context.
*Distinguish comparisons of absolute value from statements about order.

835FDD51551B4C27965FB18343421303.description: Represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.

0039B9886A594CAE99826FFD45ED9568.description: Describe quantities having opposite directions or values.

23D7D6ACA1AF4DBA9B63F7EDBA8F4EC9.description: Understand and use rational numbers to:

55DE46DF471445559D5A09151BA8601D.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.

AD71CB3C4DF345DCBA299E64A49E7069.description: Find the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12 to add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators.

3A8637284477404E93C8C487BCA3962D.description: Use the greatest common factor and the distributive property to rewrite the sum of two whole numbers, each less than or equal to 100.

D403EC965A96403E92BE02B2F5134D6D.description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100.

2DDB83E033CF4EF590A6242637CE0D5C.description: Find the unique prime factorization for a whole number.

2D55E6E1EAE946539B48919C1AE9F700.description: Understand and use prime factorization and the relationships between factors to:

EF083EA39BD14B23B8715B6804C6899C.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of decimals to develop and fluently use the standard algorithms for addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of decimals.

E738BEE54CAD4FDDAF8A16A1EAD185B0.description: Fluently divide using long division with a minimum of a four-digit dividend and interpret the quotient and remainder in context.

F60A3F14248B40BF902DCC4156F9362D.description: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.

145BA6419DD84C6B93CE812247F3BD80.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving division of fractions.

3350F9251EE3489CA63462AC30624D65.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions.

80E841BEF38842BCAB327D91B538A141.description: Use visual models and common denominators to:

4C532CAD8B2F425E8018C850DFEA6014.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.

23A97348F749424781F0F1450168309E.description: Finding the whole, given a part and the percent.

38F87CF8799845939830121220AAD2EF.description: Using equivalent ratios, such as benchmark percents (50%, 25%, 10%, 5%, 1%), to determine a part of any given quantity.

49BB181BFBFB460BA3ADC4224254638F.description: Understanding and finding a percent of a quantity as a ratio per 100.

442BCF4873EB4EA5B11682D7AF0E87E3.description: Use ratio reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems with percents by:

B3F5755E7A4F4CE5ABB225B6524D1A59.description: Plotting the pairs of values on the coordinate plane.

F6F1AA5FD6A34713B06E13ECE182E257.description: Converting and manipulating measurements using given ratios.

9420A89E3BB8441CB25E07ECF73DF49E.description: Finding missing values in the tables.

708C78AFF12346CEBD7EC5BD5965E2EB.description: Creating and using a table to compare ratios.

CC49B2289CA54963AD094C0FAFB67C9E.description: Use ratio reasoning with equivalent whole-number ratios to solve real-world and mathematical problems by:

549BCF7583D24321A56C08BA7ED392AF.description: Understand that ratios can be expressed as equivalent unit ratios by finding and interpreting both unit ratios in context

F2D992D28AEA4DCE8499D913A29B1F64.description: Model a ratio relationship using a variety of representations.

FF094344FA704BE5810DBAF0D7871C65.description: Describe a ratio as a multiplicative relationship between two quantities.

072ACD28F2DA46B685CD0E81B1A799C0.description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to:

8D1E5BAC20ED4F3EB0CE5A7929AF8A5B.description: Understand ratio concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.

52701BB1846347C7AD66A486F0C30699.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

8DBCF8D6A69847F5B9688790341D3EA7.description: Look for and make use of structure.

46BFECE0DF954032BA2BE9545033762B.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

98CE70AA26894D17AD6AC3802B352873.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

B0356BA3F87A4B7B887590C53961D435.description: NC Standards Course of Study - Math Grade 6 (2018)
